column4: hey, I just put ubuntu studio 10.10 beta on my notebook, how in the world do I connect to my open wireless g network?  Does ubuntu require you run @ least wep or wpa?
I had a similar issue in not being able to connect to open networks.  Turned out to be the driver I was using for my Wireless NIC.  Do you know what card you're using?
not sure on the card, shouldn't I beable to bring up the wlan0 interface and use iwlist to find an open network?
In theory, yes.  But your ability to do so depends on the driver your card is using.
Just a sec.
anyone know the command to bring up a network device offhand?
type 'lspci | grep Network'
Broadcom Corporation BCM4312 802.11b/g LP-PHY (rev 01)
ha!  perfect, that's exactly my card.
lol
go to system->administration->hardware drivers
deactivate the b43 driver and use the STL driver, I think
sorry, the STA driver
I don't have 'hardware drivers' in ubuntu studio, there is 'additional drivers' but I need a wan connection to use it apparently
gah, obnoxious.
you'll have to do it from the terminal.
first, confirm the b43 driver is being used.
type 'lsmod | grep b43' and see if anything comes up.
4 lines, b43 being first
My laptop battery is running dry so I'm gonna point you to a site with the instructions, just a sec.
thank you
http://linuxwireless.org/en/users/Drivers/b43
